article_text:
HCA Holdings Inc. said its second-quarter earnings rose 14% as the hospital operator reported a rebound in admissions and benefits from the U.S. health-care policy overhaul.

In a recent preview of its second-quarter results, HCA had said admissions to its hospitals rebounded and that greater-than-expected benefits from the health-care reform law contributed to the company's performance. At the time, HCA also raised its estimate of...
